build(jar): bundle JavaFX into Shadow JAR
commitResults.messageBody:
The previous JAR did not include JavaFX modules.
This caused the JAR to fail on machines without JavaFX installed.

Addded OpenJFX dependencies with a platform classifier
so Gradle Shadow produces a fat JAR.

commitResults.messageTitle: assert: add defensive assertions across parser/model
commitResults.messageBody:
Add Java assertions to document invariants and catch programmer errors:
- Parser: assert non-null input and successful tokenisation
- Commands: assert non-null dependencies and args
- TaskList: assert index bounds and non-null elements
- Storage: assert path non-null, serialised format expectations

commitResults.messageTitle: merge: A-Assertions
refactor(core): improve naming and remove duplication for code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
Refine code structure and maintainability following course code-quality principles:
- Extract small helpers in Parser and use Locale.ROOT
- Replace magic strings with private static final constants in Storage
- Reuse compiled split pattern and tidy error messages

Behaviour preserved.

feat(list): B-DoWithinPeriodTasks — add `list between <yyyy-MM-dd> <yyyy-MM-dd>` (inclusive)
commitResults.messageBody:
This change introduces a new list subcommand to filter deadlines within a date
range.

User-visible:
- New command: `list between <start> <end>` (both inclusive; yyyy-MM-dd)
- Targets only Deadline tasks (Todo/Event excluded)
- Error messages:
  - Invalid format -> `Dates must be in yyyy-MM-dd.`
  - start > end   -> `The start date must not be after the end date.`
  - No matches    -> `No deadlines in the given period.`

Implementation:
- Parser: detect `list between …` before default ListCommand and route to
  `ListBetweenCommand`.
- Command: new `ListBetweenCommand` validates inputs, then filters by
  `Deadline#getByIso()` (ISO date string; safe for lexicographic comparison)
  and renders 1..n results via Ui.
- Tests (text-ui): add scenario for empty-range; align separators with the main
  loop pre/post `showLine()` so diff is stable on all OS.
- Scripts: wire the new text-ui case into `runtest.sh/.bat` after compile.

- checkstyle.xml: note about learning rule names/CI report only.

commitResults.messageBody:
Context
- Fulfill A-AiAssisted without code authored by AI; acknowledge help only for XML/checkstyle understanding,
  commit-message phrasing, and BCD option advice (chose B-DoWithinPeriodTasks).

Changes
- Add/modify AI.md; optional credit comments in code were already introduced in prior commits.

Outcome

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(gui): apply stylesheet to the actual Scene and greet on startup
commitResults.messageBody:
Problem
- CSS was attached to a Scene instance that was never set on Stage
  (stage.setScene(new Scene(root)) created a different Scene),
  thus styles were not applied.
- App should greet first per A-BetterGui spec.

Changes
- Use the same Scene instance for setScene after attaching /view/app.css.
- MainWindow: add ESTJ startup greeting:
  "Hi, my name is ESTJ. Try your first step to be a MBTI-J person!"

Result
- Light blue theme and bubble colors are visible at launch.
- Program speaks first as intended; no changes to core logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: merge: A-BetterGui — refine CSS and add avatars (docs/assets only)
commitResults.messageBody:
- app.css finalized for light blue background, yellow program bubble, white user bubble.
- New images: /images/ESTJ.png and /images/MBTI.png.
- No core logic changes; safe for CI.

commitResults.messageTitle: style(personality): keep initialize() minimal and set requested colors
commitResults.messageBody:
Problem
- initialize() was duplicating style classes already set in constructor,
  risking duplicated CSS entries and inconsistent styling.
- A-Personality requires specific palette: app background light blue,
  program (ESTJ) bubble yellow, user bubble white.

Changes
- app.css: background set to light blue (#E6F2FF); program bubble to yellow
  (#FFF3A3); user bubble white with subtle border.

Result
- Stable left/right layout with clean styling lifecycle.
- Visuals match the requested palette exactly.

commitResults.messageTitle: merge: A-Personality — finalize palette (bg light-blue, bot yellow, user white) and simplify DialogBox.initialize()
fix(personality): show micro-phrases only on successful commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Problem
- "Nice plan!" was shown even when task format was invalid (e.g., 'deadline sleepmore'),
  because the prefix was decided from the input keyword only.

Changes
- MainWindow.handleUserInput(): generate reply first, then decide the prefix
  based on actual outcome:
  * add (todo/deadline/event): prefix only if reply starts with 'added:'.
  * mark: prefix only if not an Error/Usage and reply contains success keywords
    (marked/done/completed).

Result
- No "Nice plan!" on invalid formats.
- Micro-phrases still appear as the first line for successful commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: merge: A-Personality — gate micro-phrases by actual success
Test: Add responder, bounds, date-parse tests
commitResults.messageBody:
Increase coverage by adding cases for responder logic, boundary
conditions, and date parsing. These tests document expected behavior
and protect against regressions. No runtime changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs(user guide): Add README with quick start
commitResults.messageBody:
Add a self-contained docs/README with GUI overview, quick start,
command summary, realistic examples, troubleshooting notes
(JavaFX/headless CI), and attributions. Include Ui.png as the main
screenshot. No runtime changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs(user guide): Use relative path for image
commitResults.messageBody:
Fix a broken screenshot link on GitHub Pages that resolved to
docs/docs/Ui.png. Use a relative './Ui.png' path from docs/README.md
so the image renders correctly on the site.

commitResults.messageTitle: Build(gradle): Produce fat JAR; align Java 17
commitResults.messageBody:
Configure the Shadow plugin to build a *-all.jar, set the application
main class for `java -jar`, and align the toolchain to Java 17. No
runtime changes. Ensures the artifact in build/libs runs with
`java -jar` on Java 17 machines.
